docs.text:
This is the documentation for the 
Drupal VM Generator
 project.
docs.title: Home

docs.text:
Via Composer (recommended)


The recommended way to install the Drupal VM Generator is to require it globally with 
Composer
.


$ composer global require opdavies/drupal-vm-generator




When finished, you can test this by running 
php ~/.composer/vendor/bin/drupalvm
.


Ensure that the 
$HOME/.composer/vendor/bin
 directory (or the equivalent directory for your OS) is in your 
$PATH
 so that the 
drupalvm
 executable can be located by your system.


Via GitHub


For development purposes, you can also clone the project directly from 
GitHub
:


git clone https://github.com/opdavies/drupal-vm-generator.git




When it is finished, you will also need to run 
composer install
 to download all of the dependencies.


Alternatively, you can perform both of these actions together using the 
composer create-project
 command:


composer create-project --prefer-source --dev opdavies/drupal-vm-generator:@dev
docs.title: Installation

Ensure that the  $HOME/.composer/vendor/bin  directory (or the equivalent directory for your OS) is in your  $PATH  so that the  drupalvm  executable can be located by your system.
